metadata.dc:author: Bravo Amaro, M
Miguéns Blanco, I
metadata.dc:description: Ischaemic heart disease is the leading cause of mortality and morbidity and one of the primary causes of morbidity in Spain. The variability in the clinical presentation of this condition at both primary care and emergency services level requires a careful history and a thorough physical examination. In the case presented, the main symptoms of angina and dyspnea reported in the anamnesis, and the obvious pallor in the physical examination, were the key data to identify anaemia as a cause of angina.
metadata.dc:subject: Dyspnea
Isquemia miocárdica
Myocardial ischaemia
Coronary circulation
Disnea
Circulación coronaria
metadata.dc:title: Anemia como causa de ángor hemodinámico en el paciente con cardiopatía isquémica crónica.
[Anaemia as a cause of haemodynamic angina in a patient with chronic ischaemic heart disease].
